Case reference: 2018047905.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, an unidentified man was discovered on Highway 417, near the Pinecrest overpass on Greenbank Road, in Ottawa, Ontario. The man was riding a black “Louis Garneau” ten-speed mountain bike, with a red water bottle holder, and a pink cable lock. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2005001199.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1975, the remains of a female were found in the Nation River near a bridge crossing Highway 417 in Casselman, Ontario. She has dyed reddish blonde hair that was naturally dark brown. Her finger and toe nails had red nail polish on them. She may have been a smoker. The cause of death was strangulation. A piece of television coaxial cable was found around her neck. A curtain rod runner (plastic wheel) was found in her left armpit. Her hands and feet were tied with men's neckties, one of which is called "The Canadian Tie". Her remains may have been in the water for some days to some months.

Teeth: Other, She has extensive dental work including both an upper and lower partial denture, as well as many fillings.
Other: Towel, red and white “J cloth" brand.
2 Throw cover, green with frills on ends, 70”x40”
Towels, White & red tea towel by FREIMAN'S LTD "Irish Toast"
Tie: Blue, Red, Maple leaf emblems, Bartolini Collection

Case reference: 2012020027.CaseDesc: Maggie Lea Burke was last seen on December 9, 2004 in Edmonton, Alberta. She left her residence in the area of 118 avenue and 95 street, to go meet a friend and has not been seen since.

Hair: Brown, dyed pink purple and blond streaks at tips
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, nose stud
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, necklace with charm
Black, Remand Centre cross on a black string

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2014005017.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1967, Margaret Mildred Batoche was reported missing from her family residence in Bonnyville, Alberta. Margaret always kept in contact with her family and friends, and her disappearance is considered suspicious.

Mark: Cheek, Wart on right cheek close to ear

Case reference: 2005001899.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1978, the body of this adult male was found floating in the St. Lawrence River, near Prescott. He is described as being possibly Caucasian. His weight at autopsy was 171 lbs. and his appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of East Asian ancestry (note that this includes the Philippines).

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2015037946.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2015, Raymond Flett was seen for the last time in Thompson, Manitoba. Raymond is known to frequent the Split Lake and Thompson.

Case reference: 2014002009.CaseDesc: Leroy Marshall, AKA Roy Marshall, has been missing since July 23, 1979. Mr. Marshall moved in with his sister on the west side of Saint John in June of 1979. He had a job interview with the School District on July 23, 1979 but failed to show. Mr. Marshall lived in Somerville, Massachusetts, US, between 1961 and 1971.

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2014001045.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1976, the remains of a young adult male were found floating in the waters off Moresby Island, British Columbia. He was wearing jeans with a brown belt and had a long yellow rope tied around his waist.

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Moon and Star

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014003608.CaseDesc: Brianne Wolgram was last seen on the evening of September 5, 1998, in Revelstoke, British Columbia.  Ms. Wolgram had plans to socialize with friends that evening but did not attend.  Ms. Wolgram's vehicle was located on September 10, 1998 on the Alkolkolex Forest Service Road near Revelstoke.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2014001103.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1990, an unidentified man was found in the whirlpool of the Niagara River. He had a muscular build, may have had mild emphysema and his appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for at least 6 months.

Case reference: 2010000198.CaseDesc: Tim Mason was known to be an avid walker, frequenting trails and off-road areas. He left his house on foot during the morning and never returned. Mr. Mason suffered from heart problems.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Salt and Pepper

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2014004061.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1984, Robert Dwyer was seen for the last time when he left his residence at the Keirstead Trailer Park, which is located on the west side of Saint John, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Grey, Bomber, dark grey corduroy front

Case reference: 2014005517.CaseDesc:
At the time of her disappearance, Amber Guiboche was living in the north end of Winnipeg with her boyfriend and his family. Amber had been leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Amber spent the evening of November 10th, 2010 socializing with friends, later that evening she went to a friend’s residence on Bushnell St. She left there alone at around 11:45 p.m., and walked to the intersection of Isabel Street and William Ave.  

She was picked up there shortly after by a man driving a burgundy pickup truck. The truck was described as an older, burgundy Chevrolet Silverado, extended cab, short box with a “4x4” decal toward the rear of the box. 

The truck was last seen traveling southbound on Isabel St. It was captured on video in the area in which she was last seen.

Images of this truck and a forensic artist’s sketch of the driver have been made available.

Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2016044291.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta

Teeth: False, Upper dentures were recovered; no lower teeth present; likely this individual had lower dentures.

Case reference: 2012020659.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2012, at approximately 1:30 a.m., Brandy Wesadquate was seen for the last time leaving a house party in the 900 block of Rae Street in Regina, Saskatchewan. Since then, Brandy has not had any contact with her family or friends.

Jacket: White, Black, Zippered; Adidas brand, blue or black stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2014016772.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014 around 1PM, Yvon Guevin left his residence in Pierreville, Quebec with his vehicle, a burgundy and gray Jeep Cherokee registered in Quebec. He left with his little black dog, a "miniature Pinscher" named Costaud. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since, which is out of the ordinary.

Case reference: 2020009588.CaseDesc: On February 8, 1989, at approximately 7:30am, Soekarmia Sarbirja was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Soekarmia was to attend an immigration hearing on February 10, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2016008385.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Destiny Kazibwe was last seen at her school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Destiny's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Destiny and Adam.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Destiny or of her brother Adam.

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2015, Misty Faith Potts, from the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, was seen for the last time when she had been left at the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2006003299.CaseDesc:
On June 16, 2001, the body of a Caucasian male was found near Bayview Avenue, under the Prince Edward Viaduct on Bloor Street East, Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be approximately 5’2"-5’5" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has severe emphysema and nicotine staining on his left hand suggesting he may have been a smoker. His appendix was present.

Other: Set of small keys in pocket

Case reference: 2016068993.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1975, the body of a Caucasian female was found floating in the Detroit River near Fighting Island.Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 110-150 lbs and her length was measured at 5'4", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She had pierced ears and her appendix was present. She is believed to have been in the water a few days to a week.

Jewelry: Chain necklace with a tiny bell, a key, and a stone bead pendant.
Shoes: Red, white, and blue laced shoes with a star design on the white stripes
Belt: Silver tie belt made of cloth
Jacket: Cloth, Brown, Waist length jacket, possibly imitation fur
Mark: Abdomen, Abdominal stretch marks suggesting she may have been pregnant at one time

Case reference: 2012020084.CaseDesc: Kenneth Kettleson was an avid hunter and outdoorsman, and he led a reclusive lifestyle. Kenneth had not been seen for two weeks before he was reported missing. His residence was secure, and his vehicle was in the yard.

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim
Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs

Case reference: 2014004876.CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: Calvin Simms told a friend that he was tired of living on the street and was thinking about jumping off a bridge. Mr. Simms has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005794.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2012 at 11 p.m., Pierre Desjardins left his residence in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Quebec on foot and has not been seen since. Pierre was known to live a transient lifestyle and had made suicidal comments in the past.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Castle with a dragon on the bicep

Case reference: 2014038571.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1983, the body of this adult male was found on the south shore of Kamloops Lake east of the community of Savona in British Columbia. He had long black hair and numerous tattoos on his arms. It is believed he was deceased a few months prior to his body being recovered.

Tattoo: Left Arm, Mary C and Love, Marlene and Karene crossed-out
Right Arm, Edna and another unidentifiable tattoo

Case reference: 2016066673.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1982, a disarticulated left foot was found washed up on the shore of Lake Simcoe, in front of the Shore Room Tavern (at the end of the 10th Concession of Innisfil Township). It has been estimated to have been in the water 1-5 years.

Shoes: Brown, Two-tone brown lace-up, size 9D shoe

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP. Jody had been partying at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in the downtown area of Grande Prairie sometime later that night, or the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Buttocks, Heart Symbol on left side

Case reference: 2013000113.CaseDesc: Lana Derrick was given a ride from Houston, BC where she was going to college, to Terrace where she was dropped off at a friend's house.  Ms. Derrick spent the evening with friends hanging out in the Terrace downtown core.  In the early morning hours of October 7, 1995, Ms. Derrick picked up $30 from a friend's house and was last seen at the Copperside Foods/Petro Canada in Thornhill.  Her family reported her missing three days later when she did not show up for Thanksgiving dinner.

Case reference: 2014004060.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1973, Conor Sheehan was seen for the last time when he left his family residence in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2021018406.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in a tent in a wooded area south of the fire station located on 95 Sandalwood Parkway East in Brampton, Ontario. He was found with two pairs of reading glasses and a lighter.

Underwear: Boxer briefs; size: medium: black waistband; brand: YellowTag
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Wrist, Poorly healed fracture of right wrist

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2012020650.CaseDesc: On February 11, 2007, Danita Bigeagle was seen for the last time near the 800 block of Victoria Avenue in Regina, Saskatchewan. Danita is known to frequent the city’s downtown area, and she rarely leaves Regina.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Quilted parka with drawstring waist
Tattoo: Left Hand, Happy face and the letter "d" on the web of her left hand

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002901.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1981, Carlos Yuste was residing with friends in Thompson, Manitoba. He departed the residence and never returned. Carlos left behind all his clothing and personal belongings. He was described by his friends as being very depressed due to his unemployment. Mr. Yuste has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Aliases: GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel
YUSTE GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel

Case reference: 2014004206.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1988, 3 people were visiting Leonard Kalichak at his residence and had decided to go out in a boat on Lake Dauphin, Manitoba. When they left shore they were faced with adverse conditions subsequently capsizing the boat. At this point, Mr. Kalichak immediately went under the water, possibly as a result of heavy clothing or an injury sustained when the boat capsized. Searches were conducted by land, air, water and dragging operations on the lake. Leonard Kalichak has never been found and he is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston WALDNER was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Mr. WALDNER was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but Mr. WALDNER has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014005523.CaseDesc: In 1998, Chi Fong was seen for the last time by his mother in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005629.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2011, Yoo Heo was seen for the last time at a Youth Centre in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Yoo had recently arrived to Canada from Korea.

Case reference: 2014002435.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1978, Mary Click was seen for the last time as she left her home in Madison, Wisconsin. Mary had crossed the American and Canadian border at Pigeon River and intending to hitch hike to Banff, Alberta. Some of her personal belongings were discovered in Thunder Bay, Ontario on July 1, 1978 and Raith, Ontario on August 1, 1978.

Boots: Brown, HIKING, Possibly wearing hiking boots

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs
Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers

Case reference: 2014003380.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 1961, Brenda Byman was last seen on a hike with some classmates in the area of Wilmer, British Columbia, when she allegedly walked off into the bush and did not return. Brenda has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Blue, Parka, With pink hood

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back
Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim

Case reference: 2017063397.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2017, Brandon Cairney was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia, after travelling from his home in Port Alberni on Vancouver Island.  Brandon is known to go on hikes that cover long distances and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Back Of Head, Along the spine

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006026399.CaseDesc: Kathy Anne Lulloff was last seen wandering off into the woods off Seabrook Lake Road in the District of Algoma.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020083.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, John Roy MacLellan, 79 years old, was last seen in Lintlaw, SK. Mr. MacLellan's medical condition made him, at times, confused. In October of 1980, his vehicle was located in the Usherville district. Searches of that area have failed to locate Mr. MacLellan.

Case reference: 2007004499.CaseDesc: Rod Pavan was last heard from on August 10, 2007. Mr. Pavan advised his landlord that he was moving to British Columbia that day. His vehicle was later found near Shannon Lake Road, north of Val Cote, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2006025499.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1976, Anthony Malinak and friends arrived at Long Lake and fished during the day. That evening Mr. Malinak had taken a boat from Mountain Lodge on Long Lake. The boat was found at the east end of the lake in a foot of water.  Mr. Malinak's rain jacket and hat were found in the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, A penny with the initials "T.W."
Left Upper Arm, Bear on a rock

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2022009358.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2005, shortly after midnight, Patricia Bessel was last seen leaving her residence in Grand Island, New York. Patricia’s vehicle was subsequently located in a parking lot near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance, Patricia was despondent

Case reference: 2014004464.CaseDesc: Singh Sukmwinder Lebahna was last seen in Montreal on February 26, 2004. He left the apartment he was sharing with a friend, taking all his personal belongings, stating he wanted to live in Vancouver. Singh is originally from India.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2014005227.CaseDesc: Carl Chenier was last seen in Montreal on February 23, 2009 by the superintendent of his apartment. It is believed that he may have mental health problems, but he was not on any medications. He often used the Montreal Metro.

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time in Edmonton at approximately 6:30 in the morning.  Her abandoned vehicle was located in Rundle Park, Edmonton later the same day.

Case reference: 2012020152.CaseDesc: This adult male washed ashore at end of trail # 3 at UBC in Vancouver.

Hair: Brown, Short, Crown of dark hair and a goatee
Teeth: Good, Superior dental health, total absence of dental work, pronounced overbite and crowded lower teeth

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2014004654.CaseDesc: Richard Brokke was last seen at approximately 8:10 a.m. on July 15, 2005 leaving the 7-11 Store on St. Mary's Road in Winnipeg. His vehicle was located on July 19, 2005 near St. Jean Baptiste, Manitoba. Mr. Brokke's whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, White, Green, Golf shirt with green stripes on front

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006470.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2001, Shahzad Ahmed was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Shahzad last contacted his mother by telephone to tell her that he had been fired from his job. During the course of their conversation, his mother had told him to return home to her apartment in Toronto, but he never arrived. The next telephone call that Shahzad’s mother received was from the Islamabad police in Pakistan, who had informed her that Shahzad’s luggage had been found unclaimed on the airport luggage carousel.

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder
